storyInfo: Susie, an Infected, works at the shop 'Green Spark' in the Victorian town of Caladon. Just as her dreams are about to come true, an accident extinguishes all her hope.

attributes.text: The rumble of the Originium boilers has yet to cease. Thick plumes of smog gush out of the towering chimneys.
The workmen take off their worn-out protective gear and hand it off to the next shift.
The day is nearing its end here in Caladon.

attributes.content: November 16th, 1097, 9:50 P.M.
Nine in the evening is when the Infected factory nearby changes shifts.
Many of the workmen choose to kill time by paying Miss Quercus's shop a visit.
There is not much the shop has to offer to its patrons.
A crude fried fin cutlet, a bowl of tasteless potato soup, and a mug of fruit-wine-flavored water.
And yet, the shop has garnered a few regulars.
Cheers!
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: Cheers!
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: Hahahaha! Here's to Brande!
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: Hey, Sparky! Another pint!
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: Here you go. Your fruit wine.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: So what's going on? Why's everybody so cheery?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Mr. Brande just gave us all a bonus along with our payslips for the month!
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: They say it's a bonus, but it's just a hundred pence.
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: And considering they work us to the bone, that's the least they could owe us.
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: You sure you should be here at this hour, though? Might get a beating from the missus?
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: Jog on! I'm the king of the castle! She wouldn't dare!
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: Alright. Here's to the king of the castle!
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: Cheers!
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: Hey, Sparky! Another pint!
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: Hahaha... Mr. James, you really should watch your drink, though. We wouldn't want to upset Mrs. James.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Sparky, I heard from your boss you've got something stronger than this piss?
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: Get us some of that!
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: Not! Happening!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Remember what Miss Quercus told you. Strong drink is bad for your condition!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: You need to take better care of yourself, Stone.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Come on, what's the problem?
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: This disease is a death sentence. Might as well get a taste of the hard stuff before we cark...
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: Don't say that!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: The doctors in the city told us! Oripathy progresses differently depending on the patient's physical condition!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Lighten up, I'm just...
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: Stone!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Um... Yeah?
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: Take care of yourself and live life to the fullest! Stop saying that word all the time!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Er... Sorry?
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: Look at you. You got Sparky upset.
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: *Sigh*, I didn't mean to...
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: Huh? Looks like we've got quite a crowd here today.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Good evening, Mr. Root!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Oi, if it isn't Bitter Root! Come on, come on! Let's drink!
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: Huh? Something to celebrate today?
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Caladon's Infected community is home to many a peculiar man, and Bitter Root counts among them.
Mr. Root works for an organization called Rhodes Island. He's a 'professional' hired by the lords of the city council.
But the way Rhodes Island treats the Infected boggles the mind.
'Rhodes Island will assist the Caladon City Council and provide medical assistance to all Infected,' said their public address.
Why would anyone willingly help the Infected... especially when they're not even from here?
How's work today, Bitt? T'ain't often you get the free time to come for a drink.
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: It's fine. We hired a few extra pair of hands. Things calmed down quite a bit, thanks to them.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Eh? Is it that good working for Rhodes Island? Do they pay well?
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: What of it? You interested?
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Nah, forget I said anything. I can't even read... I'd just be making a fool of myself.
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: At first, no one in the Infected community trusted them. There were even rumors that they were here to take the late-stage Infected away for experiments.
But Rhodes Island proved themselves with their actions. They really are here to help.
Be it a regular Oripathy infection checkup, acute Oripathy attack treatment, or even just a normal workplace injury, you just walk into their clinic, and they'll help you.
Even right here, right now, there are those who have doubts about Rhodes Island's true motives. But at the very least, all of the pub's regulars trust them.
By the way, Jim, I saw your wife on my way here.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: What? What?? You sure?! Oh, bugger...
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: Ahem.
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: Er... You carry on with the drinks. I... I just remembered I've got a few errands to run. See you around!
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: Hahaha, there goes our 'king of the castle!'
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: Yeah, yeah, off I go. We'll do this another time.
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: Be safe on your way home, Mr. James.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Unlike most of the people in the establishment, Mr. James is not Infected.
In Caladon, it isn't uncommon to find non-Infected working in the Infected community.
Ever since the 'New Caladon Infected Act' came into place, a lot of the unemployed poor have been risking themselves working in the Infected factories.
A great majority of them leave the Infected community as soon as they get off work. They also avoid coming into direct contact with the Infected during working hours.
That's understandable. All of us Infected have gotten used to the attitude, and no one blames the non-Infected workmen for it.
Though, still, there are people like Mr. James.
*Sigh*. There goes my drinking buddy.
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: Come on, Bean, stop spacing out over there. Have a few pints with me.
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: Quiet down. I'm reading the newspaper.
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: What's the headlines?
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: It's all been big news the last couple of days! The whole town's talking about it. Don't tell me you haven't heard!
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: The new bill, is it? That's some big news, indeed.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: What new bill?
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: The one that's going to improve how us Infected workers are treated! Do you ever do anything except drink? This bill's going to be massive for all of us!
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Peh, and here I thought it was something that actually mattered.
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: You're naive, you know? I gave up on that hokum long ago.
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: What, you don't want them to start treating us better?
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: You think the lords actually care about us Infected? On your bike!
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: I guarantee you, this bill thing's bound to fail. It'll be unanimous, even. And then it'll be like nothing ever happened.
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: They're doing this just for show, I tell you.
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: Aha! Too bad, then! You're wrong.
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: The bill didn't pass, but it didn't fail either.
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: It was a tie. The final decision's going to have to wait till next time.
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: I'm still not buying it. It won't pass. What does the paper say, though? What's in that bill, specifically?
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: One second. Let's see... I remember some bits and pieces of it back when they announced it.
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Oh, take a look. It says here that Infected workers cannot work more than fifteen hours a day, that the factories have to give the Infected the same kinds of Originium protective equipment as non-Infected...
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Pfft. Don't make me laugh.
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: There's a snowball's chance that's true. What's that saying again? There's no pies in the sky?
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: What would you outlanders even know? Me, I'm a born-and-bred Caladonian. I've seen how they do things my whole life. No one knows the nobles how I do.
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: You're still counting on those stingy tosspots to do anything for you out of their pockets? Dream on.
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: *Sigh*... You want to at least hold out some hope... Keep a positive outlook on things.
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: There's no need to be so negative. Who could've thought ten years ago that they'd pass that New Caladonian Infected Act, right?
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Now that, that's apples to oranges.
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: Us Infected can work their factories, and the heads only have to pay us half the money. They get to pocket the other half! Of course they passed that bill!
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: That's true. Oftentimes, they don't even pay us with cash, just Wage Tickets.
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Things take time. I think you could be more optimistic about this.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Keep in mind that Caladon willingly accepts Infected from all the cities out there, and even offers work. You don't see that anywhere else in Victoria.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: I heard from some of the foremen these policies are... what... 'Columbian-style?'
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Are all the Columbian cities like this?
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Well... It's complicated. There's a tiny bit of difference.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Whatever, time for a new topic. Any other news?
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: Let's see...
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: 'Terror in Caladon! Loud Roars Heard Underground at Night!'
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: And then... 'Possible Infected Smuggling Activity Spotted in Abandoned Districts in Caladon Outskirts.'
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Then there's also this... 'Public Safety in Jeopardy, Convicts and Wanted Criminals Have Infiltrated the Infected Community.'
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Why are all the headlines like that?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: That's the 'Caladon Daily' and their rubbish reporting for you. They love their terrorizing headlines, and they take care to add the word 'Infected' in there. Just talking about those hack journos makes me want to puke.
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: It's true, but you should still be careful, Susie. Caladon hasn't been all that safe lately.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Hahaha... I'll watch out. Thanks.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: November 17th, 1097, 8:40 A.M.
Fin fillets, potatoes, green onions... I guess that's about it?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Oh, and the pepper, too!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: I just have to deliver these to Mr. Kells, right?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Yes, please.
attributes.name: Citizen

attributes.content: On my way!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Foreigners go home!
attributes.name: Protester

attributes.content: Out with the Infected! This is our home!!
attributes.name: Protester

attributes.content: Out with the Infected!
attributes.name: Loud-Mouthed Man

attributes.content: It's the Infected's fault us porters lost all our jobs!
attributes.name: Loud-Mouthed Man

attributes.content: It's not uncommon to find people protesting the Infected community here in Caladon.
When the city council passed the New Caladonian Infected Act four years ago, a large group of Infected migrated to the city for work all at once.
But the hostility between the non-Infected and the Infected didn't improve.
Hey, you! The Infected there! Get over here!
attributes.name: Loud-Mouthed Man

attributes.content: I-I'm just walking past...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: What's that you're holding? Eh?
attributes.name: Loud-Mouthed Man

attributes.content: It's just...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: What's that in your basket! Let me see it!
attributes.name: Loud-Mouthed Man

attributes.content: These are items I'm delivering to a customer!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Shouldn't your lot be working in the factories right now? What are you wandering around here for?!
attributes.name: Loud-Mouthed Man

attributes.content: It's part of my job to deliver things too...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Who said you could talk back?!
attributes.name: Loud-Mouthed Man

attributes.content: Urgh...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: (Ouch...)
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Spark... Arts...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: (Bear with it, Susie... Don't fight back...)
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: (This isn't the first time something like this has happened...)
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: What gives you Infected the right to walk the streets in broad daylight anyway?
attributes.name: Loud-Mouthed Man

attributes.content: It's all your fault the air here has gotten so polluted!
attributes.name: Loud-Mouthed Man

attributes.content: Bunch of pests! Go back to the sewers, where you belong!
attributes.name: Loud-Mouthed Man

attributes.content: (But you're the one who came to the Infected community...)
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: What? What are you looking at me for? Looking for a fight?!
attributes.name: Loud-Mouthed Man

attributes.content: That's enough, mister. Let's not overdo it.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: And who are you?
attributes.name: Loud-Mouthed Man

attributes.content: The tall, masked man helps the Feline girl up and turns around to face the thug.
There's no reason to lay hands on an unarmed lady now. It's not a very honorable thing to do, wouldn't you agree?
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: What? She's just an Infected!
attributes.name: Loud-Mouthed Man

attributes.content: And what's with you? Trying to be a hero?
attributes.name: Loud-Mouthed Man

attributes.content: Well? If you want some, come and get it!
attributes.name: Loud-Mouthed Man

attributes.content: Coward.
attributes.name: Loud-Mouthed Man

attributes.content: Mr. Red!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: I'm afraid I don't have what it takes to offend you, kind sir.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: Though before you continue, I should inform you that I have Originium crystals on my face, and your punch landed right on one.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: W-What...?
attributes.name: Loud-Mouthed Man

attributes.content: Oh, sir, this isn't good. Look, I'm bleeding out of my mouth, and your hand is injured.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: It might just get you infected too.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: What?! But...!
attributes.name: Loud-Mouthed Man

attributes.content: Hurry! To the hospital! You can still make it!
attributes.name: Protester

attributes.content: Damn you, Ursus! You'd better watch your back! You'll regret this!
attributes.name: Loud-Mouthed Man

attributes.content: Enough now! Get to the hospital!
attributes.name: Protester

attributes.content: Um, thanks... Mr. Red.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: A-Are you okay?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Don't worry about me. I'm used to taking a beating.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: I could ask you the same. Look at your face. It's all swollen.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: I-I'm okay... I'll put some ice on it when I get home.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: There've been more anti-Infected protests here lately. You should avoid this area on your way back.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: Where are you headed? I'll go with you.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: Thanks, but don't you have work? I wouldn't want to be a bother...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Don't worry yourself. I have errands in the area too.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: Mr. Red works at a nearby factory, and he visits the shop sometimes.
He may be from Ursus, but he doesn't like to drink. He prefers to read a book in the shop all by himself.
The other workers seem to really respect him. They all call him 'the bossman'.
But... Mr. Red, is that man really going to catch Oripathy?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Of course not. You don't just get infected like that. I was only scaring him.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: Oripathy can spread through blood, but he only had some minor scrapes.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: It's pretty effective as a bluff, though.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: Hahaha, I see.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Those bastards... What a lot of utter scumbags!
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: Laying hands on a young lady? Have they no shame?
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: Don't get yourself all worked up. I'm okay.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: So they ran off after they hit you? Did you see where they went?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: They ran north, so my guess is they headed to the Boil.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: The Boil, eh? It won't be easy to find them, then.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: In any case, I'll make a note. They've been fairly short staffed at the Guards lately.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Does your face still hurt? Need me to massage it a bit?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Haha... It's okay. Don't worry about me, Officer Grani.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: It's true how Caladon hasn't been that safe lately... but I didn't expect you to get attacked, Susie.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Officer Grani isn't with the local Caladon Guards. She's a Mounted Police officer temporarily loaned to the local guards and assigned to the Infected community.
Of course, the Caladon Guards aren't very interested in keeping the Infected safe. This 'short staffed' business seems to be an excuse, too.
Which makes Officer Grani one of very few local law enforcement officers willing to help the Infected.
Though just the few of them alone... can't solve all of the community's safety problems.
No loss of property... and that's filed. This is all I can do for you right now.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: I'm off now. Come find me if there's any more trouble.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Thank you, Officer Grani.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: The idiots better hope I don't find them first.
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: What if you do find them?
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: I'll beat the life out of them!
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: Think, Stone. The moment you lay a finger, everyone around will start screaming and making a fuss.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: Then, the next morning, the front page of 'Caladon Daily' will read 'Infected Batters Innocent Citizen, Security Problems Worse by the Day.'
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: Well...
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: And I remember that rotten boy and his loud mouth.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: A month ago, he was protesting the crowd in overalls, complaining how the factory he worked at was shut down because of the Infected.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: Two months ago, he protested with the hawkers and said the Infected stole his merchandise.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: So what is he today?
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: I think he said he was a 'porter'?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: What in the world!
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: Sounds like something the gangs of the Boil would do. He was probably hired. Now which lord did we offend again?
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: The Infected community's always been a thorn in the side of certain people. As long as the councilors who support the new bill aren't in the majority, these things will keep happening.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: We'd better keep our eyes peeled.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: This prick, though... Forget Susie. He even tried to fight you, bossman, and how dare he!
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: Alright, enough. Your pint's getting lonely.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: *Sigh*... How am I supposed to drink, knowing our little Sparky got harassed?
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: Hahaha, you're just exaggerating.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Sparky, take this.
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Huh? What is it?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: It's an ointment that helps reduce swelling. Anywhere it hurts, just rub some on there after you wash your face tonight.
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Huh? Now how come you're not giving me some of that?
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: This is from Yan! You know how expensive it is? Besides, look how rough you are! What do you need it for?!
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Oh... If it's that expensive, I can't take it.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: No, do. Best not work a pub with a swollen face.
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Hahaha... This isn't exactly a pub, though...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Thanks, Mr. Bean.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: In that case, your drinks are on the house tonight.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Now that's what I'm talking about!
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: Susie, are you sure you have to go?
attributes.name: Exhausted Woman

attributes.content: Yes, Mum... Staying here... isn't going to do any of us any good.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: No, Susie, listen to me... I found another job this month. Don't worry about the medicine. We'll figure something out!
attributes.name: Exhausted Woman

attributes.content: Please don't... I can't be a burden on the family anymore, not when my baby brother and sister still have school. And when my big brothers are all still healthy.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: I can't let my daughter go to another city alone!
attributes.name: Exhausted Woman

attributes.content: Don't worry about me. I heard how the Infected working in Caladon get medicine as part of their pay.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: I'm sorry... It's all my fault, Susie... I'm so sorry.
attributes.name: Exhausted Woman

attributes.content: I'll take care of myself. Don't worry, Mum.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: November 18th, 1097, 9:20 A.M.
Every now and then, I dream of my family.
I was born in Boschendal, a small town at the northern edge of Victoria.
When I was little, back when my father was still alive, he would take our whole family out to picnics.
When you're up on Mount Shay, gazing out into the distance, you can even see the vast Kazimierzian Plains.
It's been five years since the last time I went home, but my mother still sends me letters.
My family's situation has taken a turn for the better since I left. It was difficult to pay all the expenses an Infected needs with just my mother and my brothers' income.
They're living a better life, and that's more than enough for me.
Welcome!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Look who's here!
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Huh? Hi, boss!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Li'l~ Susie~
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Let me give your ears a good rub!
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Hahaha... boss... that tickles!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Boss again? Come on, don't be such a stranger!
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Hahaha... Miss Quercus.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Quercus...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: That's more like it!
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Quercus is a free-spirit, and also the owner of the shop.
Although most people here treat it like a pub, it's actually Quercus's arboretum and lighting shop.
Many have asked us why she would open such a shop in the Infected community.
And her answer has always been a very simple one.
Why open a lighting shop?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Because I want to.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: That said, Quercus actually spends very little time in Caladon.

The shop seems only to be a hobby of hers. In other words, she really meant it when she said she wanted to. She mostly works as a Messenger, spending her time bustling about in the wilderness. Most people call her the 'Druid of Gododdin.'
By the way, Quercus's Arts are actually very unique. She plants all kinds of strange flora around the shop, and she brewed most of the alcohol we sell here herself.
She even gave me my staff and Arts Unit because they can apparently help me control my own Originium Arts.
Why did you come back this time? Did you need something?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Oh? I'm not allowed to come see you without a special reason?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Hahaha...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: I have something to take care. What, have you forgotten? It's almost the end of the year!
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Oh, right...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: This is a defining moment for me.
I've been saving up money for a few years now. I want to buy this place.
I want to have my own shop here in Caladon. No matter what I do, this will be the beginning of my independence.
And Quercus often tells me that the shop's landlord has been thinking about renting to someone else, and that she doesn't have much time to take care of it.
So you've saved up all this? That's amazing, Susie!
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: But, Quercus... Are you sure it's okay? Isn't it a bit on the low side for a place like this?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: How many times have you asked me that now? Do you not trust me?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: No, I mean... Of course I trust you.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: I'll get you a meeting with the landlord sometime next week for you to work out the details. He's a dependable one.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Next week, huh...?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: November 18th, 1097, 9:56 P.M.
Here's your tea, Miss Mountbelan.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Thanks.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Ethelflaed Julie Mountbelan is one of our regulars. She's just Miss Mountbelan to us.
She's another of Rhodes Island's experts. She's in charge of coming up with solutions to solve Infected problems for the council.
Just like Mr. Root, she got along with our other customers straight away.
The Mountbelan name is known far and wide in the country, so I still haven't grown completely used to seeing a lady from such a prestigious family having tea around the Infected community.
Judging by your look, I suppose the lords did something to make you unhappy?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Miss Mountbelan takes a sip of tea. Both her lips and the blood vessels on her forehead are twitching.
Can you believe it? Can you believe it?!
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: I spent two weeks preparing all that data, and they only read a single page of it!
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Just one page!!
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: How short-sighted can they be?! The issues I raised are urgent to the point they need addressing right now! You can't tell me it doesn't worry them one bit?!
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Oh, they don't worry about the fire until it's started burning them.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: It this drags on, it'll immolate them completely.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Hasn't the Reunion mayhem in Gododdin taught them anything?
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: The flames of Reunion Gododdin were stomped out two years ago. Why would it be a problem to these noble lords?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Things aren't that simple, though! It's as though they don't even understand the crux of the matter! Reunion isn't just a band of thugs or bandits. There's a reason they started that uprising.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Oi, is it just me or did it get warmer in here all of a sudden?
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: Yeah, I think it did.
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: Not again. Cool it a little. Don't burn my store down.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: *Sigh*... Never mind.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Hahaha... Calm down, Miss Mountbelan.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: You're off work. Try to keep a happier face on, I think.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Here, give these a try.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: What do you have here... Sweets?
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: That's right. Quercus made these vanilla mints herself. Let them calm your rage.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: *Sigh*... Thanks...
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: I was on a holiday in Siesta just a few months ago... and now I'm starting to miss that place.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: It sounds like you've really had it tough, Miss Mountbelan. Loosen up some if you can.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: At least I have you lot to listen to me grumble here.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: You can't do that at Rhodes Island?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: You think my case is bad? Everyone has it tough there... Kicking up a fuss at work would only hurt morale.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Don't worry, we're all a bunch of idiots. By the time you finish a sentence, we've gone and forgotten what you said.
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: So, what conclusion did the lords arrive at?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Well, halfway through the meeting, they started fixating on all those silly rumors.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: You mean like the 'sounds in the city underground' and 'criminals have infiltrated the Infected community?'
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: In the end, it's all the Infected's fault, eh?
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Right, it's all just baseless conspiracy theories. It's a mystery to me who's even been spreading them.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Anyway, the meeting devolved into a pointless shouting match after that.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: It sounds like a lot of the lords support the Infected community, though?
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: We do solve a lot of their problems, after all. Some of the lords have made a good bit of dough over the last few years. Likelihood is they're just more amenable to it than most, considering they're directly profiting.
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Besides, the community doesn't only concern the Infected anymore. There's plenty of non-Infected working here now, right?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: That's true. I'm one of them right here.
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: Right, that's a fair point... but talking about it all here and now won't change a thing. I still have other engagements tomorrow, so if you'll excuse me.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Be careful out there.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Now setting that aside...
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Why are you working here in our community, James? It's strange for me to say, but isn't it a bit risky, on shift with the Infected?
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Risky... eh?
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: Tell you the truth, risks are, in the end, nothing more than an unknown. Putting food on the table, that's the immediate problem.
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: If worse comes to worst, suppose I actually catch Oripathy, my family are still going to live better than if I didn't have a job.
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: I've got two little mouths to feed. I can't just leave it to my wife to be the breadwinner. Besides, it's not like she makes much, selling scarves. We wouldn't be able to get by.
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: My mum's got asthma. It costs an arm and a leg to treat. My dad's got some serious bone disease too. He can't even get out of bed.
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: I don't have a choice. If only I could find better work...
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: *Sigh*... How come it sounds like your life's more of a mess than mine?
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Why're you so quiet today, Stone? Did something happen?
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: *cough*... How old did James say his kids are again?
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: One's eight, the other twelve. Why?
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: No... No reason. Just thinking.
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: Come on, if you've got something on your mind, just say it. It's not like we're strangers.
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Did you run into some kind of trouble, Stone?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Trouble, huh...? *Sigh*.
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: I-I got a letter from my wife. She said she'll come pay me a visit with our daughter.
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: A daughter? You have a daughter?!
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Eh? I didn't know you were married!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: What?! Is it that strange to you?
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: No, not like that. Just... an Infected having a kid...
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Oh, don't you worry about that. I caught Oripathy afterwards. My wife and daughter are fine.
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: Isn't that a good thing? Why the long face?
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Right, you got Oripathy, and your wife didn't abandon you. Wish the missus cared about me like that.
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: *Sigh*, look at me. How am I supposed to face them the way I am now?
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: What's wrong with the way you are?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Right, why look down on yourself like that?
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: It's true, though. You're not exactly in good shape to see her.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Why don't we get you a haircut? You could at least be a little better groomed?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Alright! If it's a haircut Stone needs...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: (Brandishes a pair of scissors and a comb)
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Hold your beasties! You know how to cut hair, Sparky?
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: Now, don't underestimate her! My girl Susie's a master hairdresser.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Ta-dah!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Well, doesn't that look pretty good?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: I don't usually cut it so short. Feels all breezy...
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: Hey, you're looking fresh.
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: I think you can do a lot for yourself if you pay just a little more attention to your hair, Stone.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: *Sigh*. Look at me, though. My life's a disaster. How am I supposed to find time to care about my hair?
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: Don't think like that!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: It's because life's so hard that we should find our own ways to live better.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Right. No one's ever said the Infected have to live in misery.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Chin up. Your wife will be delighted to see you like this.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Take it slow. You come to my room later.
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: I've got some clean clothes I've been holding onto. Haven't worn them much. Give them a wash and see if they fit.
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Eh... You sure about that?
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: What's to stand on ceremony? Just take them!
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Now come on, drink up!
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: November 23rd, 1097, 10:35 A.M.
Today's the day.
I'm meeting the landlord.
There's a thick stack of cash in front of me.
Six thousand, five hundred pounds. This amount of money was once unthinkable to me.
When I was little, one of my brothers broke an Originium lamp we had. Mum gave him a really good spanking.
That was the first time I saw her get that angry. She needed that lamp to patrol the mineshaft at night.
The lamp was worth a hundred and fifty pounds. It was almost her entire month's salary. That's what got her so angry.
How many Originium lamps could six thousand and five hundred pounds buy?
I assess the enormity of the heavy, foul-smelling pile of sacrifice before me.
All the meals I've skipped over the years. All the hardships I've suffered through.
Six thousand, five hundred pounds.
These sheets of paper are like a bridge I laid myself, brick by brick. On the other side stands my dreams.
Susie! Get it together!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: You're just meeting with the landlord! He's just a landlord!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: From tomorrow onwards, you'll be the shop's owner! Your dream is coming true!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: You're almost there, Susie!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: I look in the mirror and give my cheeks a good slap.
How should I greet him?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: 'Nice to meet you, sir! I'm very glad to...'
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: No, the smile's too stiff.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: My dream is about to come true, but I don't feel the least bit excited. On the contrary, I'm growing more and more afraid of seeing the man about to walk into the shop.
The landlord... What kind of a person is he?
Is he infected or not? Will he really sell the shop to me?
He's selling it to me so cheap. Could it be a scam?
Is he doing this because, like everyone else, he just wants to make fun of me, to humiliate me?
M-Maybe Quercus isn't Infected either... Maybe they're in on this together, just to...
Ahhh! What am I thinking!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: I smack my face hard.
I'm using pain to suppress these shameful, despicable emotions.
Don't be like this, Susie! This is hideous!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: I stare into the mirror. The only thing that can be heard inside the quiet shop is the clock's ticking.
It's like torture.
Susie! Are you there?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Ehhh?!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Watch your Arts!
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: What's the matter with you? What are you so scared of? Did something happen?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: No... I'm okay! Good morning, Miss Quercus.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: (Doubtful glare)
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Look at those dark circles under your eyes!
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: What's wrong? Did you not sleep well?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Hahaha... I was a little nervous.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Good morning, Miss Susie.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Oh! Mr. Root! Sorry, I didn't see...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Huh? What time is it?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Oh, sorry, Mr. Root. We aren't open today. Did you need something?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: You haven't told her yet, Quercus?
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Oh, you're right. I haven't.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: I forgot to mention it, but he's the landlord who owns the shop.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Eh?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Ehhh??
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Mr. Root's the landlord? So the previous owners signed their contracts with Mr. Root?!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: It's a long story... Anyway, Rhodes Island actually owns this property.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: I've heard the details from Quercus. Miss Susie, you want to buy the store, is that right?
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Permit me to ask, then. What kind of business do you want to run here?
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Business?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Oh! Business!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: M-My father was a hairdresser.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: When I was little, he often said... we shouldn't change our attitude towards life just because we're poor.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Hairdressing may seem trivial, but if someone's putting in the effort to keep themselves groomed, then they must still carry the will to live.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: That's why I thought...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: It would be nice... to open a hair salon in the Infected community.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Hairdressing, huh...? For the Infected?
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: That sounds very nice.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: It's a deal, then! Someone will come to sort out the contract later.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Eh? That's it?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: We've known each other for a long time, haven't we? You'll be fine, Susie.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: My own shop... It feels like... I'm dreaming.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: That reminds me. Where will you go now, Miss Quercus? Are you going to leave the city?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Oh, don't look at me like that. It's not like I won't ever come back.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: I'll stop by every now and then. I have lots of friends in town, you know?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Oh, and one last thing.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Susie, Quercus got you a little gift.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: A gift? Huh?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Come, Susie. Everyone's waiting for you.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Congratulations!
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: You did it, Susie!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Officer Grani! Why are you here?!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Alright! Now Sparky's the owner! Make sure you keep the booze we like on the taps!
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: Congratulations, Susie.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: Mr. Red! Aren't you supposed to be working?!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Oh, we took the day off. We weren't going to miss the moment you took over the shop.
attributes.name: Stone the Infected

attributes.content: That's right. I've been coming here every day for the last few years now. I probably know this place better than I do my own home.
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: Your wife could give you a good socking for that.
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Alrighty, then. Miss Susie, our new owner, the shop is all yours!
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Oh, why are you tearing up? Don't cry!
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Yeah, no crying.
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: Life's been hard for all of us lately. It's not often we get something to celebrate, yeah?
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: Cheer up!
attributes.name: James the Worker

attributes.content: Anyway, it doesn't matter what you turn the place into. I'll be here.
attributes.name: Bean the Infected

attributes.content: Hahaha... What's this? Tears of joy?
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: (Breaking up) Miss Quercus... I...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Okay, okay now. No more tears...
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: My dream—
To the Infected, dreams are distant and unattainable.
My dream has always been to have my own shop, my own life.
So I wouldn't have to be a burden on my family anymore.
And now, my dream is about to come true. It's an unimaginable luxury for an Infected.
Does that make me lucky?
November 24th, 1097, 6:35 A.M.
Smoke...
A thick layer of smoke spreads from a corner of the Infected community, breaking the morning tranquility.
Evacuate the nearby residents first!
attributes.name: Guards Member

attributes.content: You there, quit dawdling about! Nothing to see here!
attributes.name: Guards Member

attributes.content: Over here! The fire's still going!
attributes.name: Firefighter

attributes.content: Check again for casualties! This is the Infected community!
attributes.name: Firefighter

attributes.content: Look for any traces of Originium, like damaged appliances!
attributes.name: Firefighter

attributes.content: Don't let any activated dust spread!
attributes.name: Firefighter

attributes.content: Bloody hell... Why's somebody setting fires around here?!
attributes.name: Guards Member

attributes.content: Why...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Evacuate everyone first! Hey, you, Feline over there! What are you doing?!
attributes.name: Guards Member

attributes.content: Smoke...
The smoke and scorched stench fill the air.
The burning leather and timber crack apart in the lingering heat.
Don't run in there! Are you daft?!
attributes.name: Firefighter

attributes.content: Hold her back!
attributes.name: Guards Member

attributes.content: Why...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: The girl is unwilling to believe what she sees before her. She wants to close her eyes.
This has to be a dream.
This has to be a bad dream.
Right. The moment she opens her eyes, she'll be free of this nightmare.
Yes, when she open her eyes, she'll be greeted by the same old ceiling. A new day awaits her. A new day with her own shop.
But the shop before her is nothing but a pile of rubble engulfed in flames.
Of the sign that once read 'Green Spark,' nothing remains but a few burnt fragments. It matches the walls and ceiling, long since rendered ash.
Before her eyes lies what was once her dreams, her hopes, and her future.
All of it now buried in this burning rubble.
Why...?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: The will that once helped the Feline girl through countless tribulations can support her small body no longer.
She falls to her knees.
The scorching ashes burns her hands and legs. The broken fragments cut through her skin.

attributes.text: In the ruins of despair, an Infected lost everything.
And so the blaze is extinguished.
